definition: can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])
to speak/to talk/to converse/to chat/to discuss
summit talks/discussion between heads of state

sentences.english: Weekly con calls will be setup to monitor progress along with documentation of deliverables.
sentences.chinese: 除了交付的文件，每週還要舉行電話會談以監督進程。

sentences.english: Cameron held a grand welcome ceremony for Wen prior to the talks.
sentences.chinese: 會談前，卡梅倫爲溫家寶舉行了隆重的歡迎儀式。

sentences.english: We agreed on the importance of resuming the six-party talks as soon as possible.
sentences.chinese: 我們一致認爲儘快恢復六方會談是重要的。

sentences.english: There have been no six-party talks with North Korea since 2009.
sentences.chinese: 六方會談自2009年以來一直陷於停頓。

sentences.english: Prior to the talks, Wen Jiabao held a welcoming ceremony for Christies visit to China.
sentences.chinese: 會談前，溫家寶爲克里斯蒂訪華舉行了歡迎儀式。

sentences.english: The meeting times printed on our programs were largely theoretical.
sentences.chinese: 印在我們日程表上的會談時間基本上不算數。

sentences.english: But if the Sensis want to talk, we would be ready.
sentences.chinese: 但如果森西家族想進行會談，那我們已經準備好了。

sentences.english: Obama and Medvedev have scheduled a four-hour session for Monday.
sentences.chinese: 奧巴馬和梅德韋傑夫計劃在週一舉行四個小時的會談。

sentences.english: Zhang Aihua, Vice-president of CFNA, attended the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 張愛華副會長代表我會參加了會談。

sentences.english: Kim Yong Chun suggested that the high-level military talks at the end of the preparatory talks.
sentences.chinese: 金永春建議本月底舉行高級軍事會談的預備會談。

sentences.english: Kim Yong Chun suggested that the high-level military talks at the end of the preparatory talks.
sentences.chinese: 金永春建議本月底舉行高級軍事會談的預備會談。

sentences.english: Prior to the talks, Thein Sein held a welcome ceremony for Wen.
sentences.chinese: 會談前，登盛爲溫家寶舉行了歡迎儀式。

sentences.english: The two also had a 40-minute meeting in the Oval Office.
sentences.chinese: 兩人在橢圓形辦公室單獨會談了40分鐘。

sentences.english: Next week, leaders of theworldworld's largest economies will meet in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania.
sentences.chinese: 下週，世界經濟大國會在賓夕凡尼亞州的匹茲堡會談。

sentences.english: Bosworth also held a separate meeting with South Korean Foreign Minister Kim Sung-hwan.
sentences.chinese: 博斯沃思還和韓國外交通商部長官金星煥舉行了會談。

sentences.english: After the talks, Hu and Koehler witnessed the signing of cooperative deals between the two countries.
sentences.chinese: 會談後，兩國領導人出席了雙邊合作文件的簽字儀式。

definition: to meet with (sb who is paying a visit)/CL:次[ci4]
to consult with/to talk things over/agreement
